What are some examples of using the `sendcurrency` API to send and convert funds in Verus, and how do you define a new currency in Verus?

The `sendcurrency` API in Verus is a powerful tool that allows users to send and convert funds between different addresses and currencies. Here are some examples of how to use it:

**Sending Funds:**
To send funds from a single address to another, you can use the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "bob@" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10}]'
```
This will send 10 VRSCTEST from the address `bob@` to the address `alice@`.

**Sending Funds from All Wallet Funds:**
To send funds from all wallet funds to multiple recipients, you can use the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"currency":"vrsctest","address":"alice@","amount":10},{"currency":"VRSCTEST","address":"bob@","amount":10}]'
```
This will send 10 VRSCTEST from all wallet funds to both `alice@` and `bob@`.

**Converting Funds:**
To convert funds from one currency to another, you can use the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"VRSC-BTC"}]'
```
This will convert 10 VRSCTEST to VRSC-BTC and send it to the address `bob@`.

**Converting Funds through a Fractional Currency:**
To convert funds through a fractional currency, you can use the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"bob@","amount":10, "convertto":"BTC","via":"VRSC-BTC"}]'
```
This will convert 10 VRSCTEST to BTC through the fractional currency VRSC-BTC and send it to the address `bob@`.

**Preconverting Funds:**
To preconvert funds to a new currency before it is active, you can use the following command:
```
verus -chain=VRSCTEST sendcurrency "*" '[{"address":"alice@","amount":10, "convertto":"NEWCOIN", "preconvert":true, "refundto":"alice@"}]'
```
This will preconvert 10 VRSCTEST to the new currency NEWCOIN before it is active and send it to the address `alice@`.

To define a new currency in Verus, you need to have an ID of the same name as the currency. The controller of this ID is the only one who can create a currency of that name, and they can only do so once.
